did.unittitle: Shenandoah Valley Miscellaneous Ledgers, Minute Books, and Registers,
did.physdesc: 4.6 linear feet; 41 ledgers; 6 hollinger boxes; 2.5 oversize hollinger boxes; 1 flat item
did.abstract: The Shenandoah Valley Miscellaneous Ledgers, Minute Books, and Registers, 1804-1933, are comprised of an assortment of bound record books from various organizations and individuals, documenting a variety of agricultural, social, commercial, and educational endeavors in Harrisonburg and surrounding counties in the 19th and 20th centuries.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection. Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the James Madison University Special Collections Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: This collection is owned by the Harrisonburg-Rockingham Historical Society. Written permission to quote or publish any part of this collection must be obtained through Carrier Library Special Collections on behalf of the Society. The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to the James Madison University Special Collection Library. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library Reference Desk (library-special@jmu.edu).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of Item], [box #, folder #], Shenandoah Valley Miscellaneous Ledgers, Minute Books and Registers, 1804-1933, bulk 1820s-1890s, SC 0079, on deposit from Harrisonburg-Rockingham Historical Society, Dayton, Va., housed in Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University, Harrisonburg, VA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was place on deposit by contract with the Harrisonburg-Rockingham Historical Society. The first five books were acquired in 1985; further additions were made in 1992 and 1995.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: This collection is an amalgamation of a number of business and personal ledgers, minute books, and registers that are owned by the Historical Society. The collection is representative of multiple donations to the Historical Society, and in turn, multiple deposits to JMU.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Books designated as flat by "FL" were rearranged in the summer of 2008 to maximize storage space. Books FL#1-12 are listed in the contents list below according to their physical arrangement. In order to streamline the process of applying collection numbers, Special Collections staff completed a large-scale renumbering campaign in the spring of 2017. This collection was previously cataloged as SC 2005.

altformavail.head: Alternative Form Available
altformavail.p: Other Formats Available: Also available on microfilm, housed in Special Collections. Additional copies of the microfilm are owned by the Harrisonburg-Rockingham Historical Society and the Library of Virginia.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Book 1 is the contract book of the Tobacco Growers Cooperative Association (now called the Tri-State Tobacco Growers Association). The Association was founded in 1922 and acts as a marketing association for the two Carolinas and Virginia, including Rockingham County where attempts were made to grow tobacco in the 1920s. Book 2, an unidentified business ledger, 1856 to 1858, lists sales of brandy as well as other items and labor. Book 3 is representative of the Grottoes Investment Company, a real estate investment company founded in 1891 at Shendun (now known as Grottoes, Virginia). The Ashby Memorial Association was a Confederate veteran's organization founded in 1897 whose membership included those from the S.B. Gibbons Camp, the Turner Ashby Chapter of the Daughters of the Confederacy and the Turner Ashby Camp of Sons of Confederate Veterans. Book 4 includes the minutes of the Ashby Memorial Association from July 1897 to April 1898. Book 5 is the school register for Public White School No. Six. The school was one of several schools located in the Plains District of Rockingham County. Book 20 records the accounts of the Valley Turnpike Company. Incorporated in 1834, the company was one of several companies authorized to construct a number of toll roads, including the one from Staunton to Winchester. Book 21 has been transcribed and published as the Michael Baker Store Account Book; see Related Material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Shenandoah Valley Miscellaneous Ledgers, Minute Books and Registers, 1804-1933, are comprised of an assortment of bound record books from various organizations and individuals, documenting a variety of agricultural, social, commercial, and educational endeavors in Harrisonburg and surrounding counties in the 19th and 20th centuries. Books 1-5 represent the first acquisition of the collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection was numerically arranged based on the order of accession. In the summer of 2008, the physical order of the books was changed to maximize storage space, however original numbering was retained. See the contents list below for the current physical arrangement.

did.unittitle: Book 1: Tobacco Growers Cooperative Association, Contract Book (Book 1), 1923-1924

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains marketing and association agreements. Folder contains agreement, affidavit, and two letters.

did.unittitle: Book 2: Unidentified business ledger (Book 2), 1856-1858

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: List sales of brandy as well as other items and labor.

did.unittitle: Book 3: Grottoes Investment Company, Board of Directors Minutes (Book 3), April 1891-October 1892
Book 4: Ashby Memorial Association, Minutes (Book 4), July 1897 - April 1898
Book 5: Public White School No. 6, Plains District, Rockingham County, School Register (Book 5), October 1888 - April 1895

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Lists pupils, subjects, attendance registers, and description of school house.

did.unittitle: Book 6: John Werner Ledger (Book 6), 1868-1876

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Mostly shoe repairs and manufacture

did.unittitle: Book 7: Unidentified Ledger (Book 7), 1873-1890

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Shoes, farm items and labor

did.unittitle: Book 8: James Bush Ledger (Book 8), 1858-1867

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Records agricultural labor and payment

did.unittitle: Book 9: George Kiser, Estate Accounts (Book 9), 1895-1896
Book 10: David Kyle Ledger (Book 10), 1868-1876

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes livestock and other agricultural transactions

did.unittitle: Book 11: Harvey Kyle Ledger (Book 11), 1837-1881

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Lists visits and medicine, including to Negroes and later entries concern land, bonds, etc.

did.unittitle: Book 12: James Kyle, Account Book (Book 12), 1840-1846

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Lists various items from spices to furniture; back cover gives data on Kyle's moves around the Valley.

did.unittitle: Book 13: David Kyle, Estate Accounts (Book 13), 1844-1868
Book 14: John Burkholder Ledger (Book 14), 1862-1863
Book 15: Funkhauser Paul Ledger (Book 15), 1861-1865
Book 16: Unidentified Ledger (Book 16), 1819-1820

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: may be the daybook of a Harrisonburg general store

did.unittitle: Book 17: William Bushnell's Ledger; Carriage maker, Harrisonburg, Va (Book 17), 1818-1826
Book 18: Peter Roller Ledger (Book 18), 1833-1851

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Ledger of agricultural & some dry goods.

did.unittitle: Book 19: Robert Gray Ledger (Book 19), 1813-1836
Book 20: Ledger of Valley Turnpike County (Book 20), 1886-1900

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: accounts, bonds, interest, repairs, expenses, and salaries.

did.unittitle: Book 21: Joseph and John Baker Daybook (Book 21), 1804-1821
Book 22: Daybook of David Steele (Book 22), 1843-1846

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: mostly food and wood

did.unittitle: Book 23: Giles Devier, Newspaper Subscription Ledger (Book 23), 1879-1883
Book 24: Post Office Account Ledger (Book 24), 1889-1911
Book 25: Cosby Mills Ledger (Book 25), 1893-1894, 1930 1930
Book 26: Harrisonburg (Va.) Post Office, Custodian's Record Book (Book 26), 1912-1933
Book 27: John C. Morrison Account Book (Book 27), 1857-1866
Book 28: Unidentified, Account book and travel diary (Book 28), 1818-1827

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Partly in German

did.unittitle: Book 29: Singers Glen Council Minutes (Book 29), 1894-1919
Flat Book 6: Addison Munch Daybook, Seven Fountains, VA (Flat Book 6), 1876-1877
Flat Book 8: Seven Fountains Nursery, Apple Book (Flat Book 8), 1880

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Pictures of popular apple types.

did.unittitle: Flat Book 9: Bradley Foundry Ledger (Flat Book 9), 1856-1871
Flat Book 1: Samuel Bowman Ledger (Flat Book 1), 1818-1857

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Sales, hauling, & odd jobs; receipts & orders associated with Bowman's Mill

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Sales at the store of James Habron.
